testRuntime "com.h2database:h2:1.2.147"
Groovy changed XmlParsing in 2.3.0+, node.text() has a bug and returns all
of the nested node text() as one value
foo.text() --> "ab"
Previous versions, foo.text() --> ""
Even though the Javadoc doesn't change, the functionality is very different (in a
non backward compatible way).

In order to work around a really flagrant bug ( http://issues.gradle.org/browse/GRADLE-732 )
You have to create a configuration that includes the jar.archivePath (the jar.archivePath is created by the java plugin)
and give it the same name as the cucumberRuntime configuration, or name it something different and have the cucumberRuntime
configuration extend from it as well.
Still a bug in gradle 2.4, despite their saying that they would fix it before 1.0
VERY ANNOYING BUG

groovy 'org.codehaus.groovy:groovy-all:2.0.0-beta-2'
In order to work around a really flagrant bug ( http://issues.gradle.org/browse/GRADLE-732 )
You have to create a configuration that includes the jar.archivePath (the jar.archivePath is created by the java plugin)
and give it the same name as the cucumberRuntime configuration, or name it something different and have the cucumberRuntime
configuration extend from it as well.
VERY ANNOYING BUG

E.g.
compile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for compile time deps - this will end up in your module too!
testCompile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for test time deps
provided "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - if you DON'T want it to be packaged in the module zip

Add your module jar dependencies here
E.g.
compile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for compile time deps - this will end up in your module too!
testCompile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for test time deps
provided "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - if you DON'T want it to be packaged in the module zip

Add your module jar dependencies here
E.g.
compile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for compile time deps - this will end up in your module too!
testCompile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for test time deps
provided "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - if you DON'T want it to be packaged in the module zip

Add your module jar dependencies here
E.g.
compile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for compile time deps - this will end up in your module too!
testCompile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for test time deps
provided "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - if you DON'T want it to be packaged in the module zip
"com.sun.jersey:jersey-json:${jerseyVersion}",

Add your module jar dependencies here
E.g.
compile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for compile time deps - this will end up in your module too!
testCompile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for test time deps
provided "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - if you DON'T want it to be packaged in the module zip

In order to work around a really flagrant bug ( http://issues.gradle.org/browse/GRADLE-732 )
You have to create a configuration that includes the jar.archivePath (the jar.archivePath is created by the java plugin)
and give it the same name as the cucumberRuntime configuration, or name it something different and have the cucumberRuntime
configuration extend from it as well.
VERY ANNOYING BUG

testCompile 'info.cukes:cucumber-junit:1.1.2'
testCompile 'info.cukes:cucumber-groovy:1.1.2'

Add your module jar dependencies here
E.g.
compile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for compile time deps - this will end up in your module too!
testCompile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for test time deps
provided "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - if you DON'T want it to be packaged in the module zip

Add your module jar dependencies here
E.g.
compile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for compile time deps - this will end up in your module too!
testCompile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for test time deps
provided "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - if you DON'T want it to be packaged in the module zip

E.g.
compile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for compile time deps - this will end up in your module too!
testCompile "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - for test time deps
provided "com.foo:foo-lib:1.0.1" - if you DON'T want it to be packaged in the module zip
